SUMMARY: As part of the plan to reintroduce cheetahs into India, South Africa is sending 12 of the cats to the country. They will join eight other cheetahs which were sent by Nambia.

TITLE: Britain's Treasury chief believes the country cannot cut taxes until the inflation rate drops
SUMMARY: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt believes cutting inflation is necessary before any tax cuts. Rishi Sunak promised to halve the inflation rate by the end of the year.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: What's Russia up to in Africa?
SUMMARY: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov visited a handful of African countries this last week as Moscow seeks to widen its influence on the continent.

TITLE: Jerusalem synagogue shooting: At least 5 dead after gunman opens fire, Israel police say
SUMMARY: A terrorist shooting at a synagogue in Jerusalem has left five Israelis dead and several more injured. The suspect has been killed.

TITLE: Notorious Russian criminal freed from Putin's jails after fighting in Ukraine: report
SUMMARY: Wagner Group chief Yevgeniy Prigozhin argued that he would rather use prisoners than send fresh recruits, whom he called "dandelion boys," to the front lines of Ukraine.

TITLE: European Union, Pfizer working on deal to pay more for COVID-19 vaccines in exchange for lower volume
SUMMARY: The European Union wants to make a deal with Pfizer to pay more in order to reduce the volume of vaccines it purchases. The EU already agreed to purchase half a billion vaccine doses.

TITLE: North Korea condemns US President Joe Biden's decision to send battle tanks to Ukraine
SUMMARY: President Biden announced that the U.S. was sending 31 tanks to Ukraine amid the country's war with Russia. The decision to send tanks was condemned by North Korea.

TITLE: Storm Cheneso picks up in Madagascar, more flooding to come
SUMMARY: The tropical storm Cheneso has started to pick up in parts of Madagascar this week. Madagascar officials say that more flooding is to come over the weekend.

TITLE: Russian shelling leaves 10 Ukrainian civilians dead, 20 injured, Zelenskyy says
SUMMARY: The office of Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated Friday, January 27, a new Russian shelling killed 10 Ukrainians and left 20 civilians injured.

TITLE: Jerusalem synagogue shooting: At least 7 dead after gunman opens fire, Israeli police say
SUMMARY: A terrorist shooting at a synagogue in Jerusalem has left at least seven dead and several more injured. Police killed the shooter, according to authorities.

TITLE: Colombia's Arhuacos strive for harmony with Mother Nature
SUMMARY: The Arhuacos in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta follow the Law of Origin as a guide to spiritual knowledge and behavior. Their goal is to focus on restoring damage to Mother Earth.

TITLE: Air Force general predicts war with China in 2025: 'I hope I am wrong'
SUMMARY: A four-star Air Force General predicted that the U.S. will be at war with China by 2025 and advised his commanders to prepare.

TITLE: Russia's major offensive planned by one-year anniversary of invasion, top security official warns
SUMMARY: Russia is planning a major offensive against Kyiv by the one-year anniversary of its invasion of Ukraine on Feb. 24, the National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov warned.

TITLE: Climate change protesters in The Hague block highway, get detained and hauled away by bus
SUMMARY: Hundreds of climate activists on Saturday blocked one of the main roads into the international criminal court, The Hague, in a show of protest over fossil fuel linked tax breaks.

TITLE: Ukrainian TV star fundraises $100 million for country's army
SUMMARY: One of Ukraine's top show business personalities has switched his role from TV star to prolific fundraiser. Serhiy Prytula has raised $100 million since Russia invaded his country in February 2022.

TITLE: In Europe 'a new generation of bank robbers' target ATMs with explosives, stealing millions
SUMMARY: Professional gangs have swooped into Germany over the years to rob ATMs. German authorities are starting to fight back against the criminals.

TITLE: Indian Air Force fighters jets crash in mid-air, killing pilot: See the wreckage
SUMMARY: Two fighter jets in India's Air Force crashed into each other Saturday, leaving one pilot dead and two others injured and landing in an open field.

TITLE: Transgender woman, who stalked a girl as a man, granted transfer to Scotland all-women's prison: report
SUMMARY: Violent trans prisoner Tiffany Scott has reportedly been granted permission to transfer to an all-women's Scottish prison despite history of targeting females.

TITLE: Jerusalem shooting: Alleged 13-year-old Palestinian gunman apprehended by armed Israeli citizen
SUMMARY: Israeli Police responded within minutes and were able to apprehend the shooter before he could drive away, giving him treatment in a police ambulance after his arrest.

TITLE: Zelenskyy warns International Olympic Committee against allowing Russia 'terrorist state' into games
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday blasted the International Olympic Committee (IOC) over its plan to include Russian athletes in the upcoming 2024 Paris Olympics.

TITLE: Great white shark decapitates Mexican diver marking first fatal shark attack of 2023: Report
SUMMARY: A Mexican fisherman became the first person killed in a shark attack this year after he was reportedly decapitated in an attack by a 19-foot great white shark.

TITLE: Iran military facility rocked by explosion that officials say was 'unsuccessful' drone attack
SUMMARY: A military facility in Iran was reportedly rocked by a loud blast which officials in the country say was the result of a failed drone strike that resulted in no casualties.

TITLE: London worker dead after being crushed by urinal
SUMMARY: A London maintenance worker was crushed underneath a telescopic urinal Friday while working on the hydraulic machine, police said.

TITLE: Biden extends deportation protections for Hong Kong residents amid 'increasing repression' in China
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed off on a two-year extension of a program that protects Hong Kong residents in the U.S. from deportation due to "increased repression" from the Chinese government.

TITLE: Ukraine renews calls for US F-16s, German fighter jets after countries reverse decision on sending tanks
SUMMARY: Ukraine is engaged in negotiations for the United States and Germany to send fighter jets to help provide support for tanks the Western countries agreed to send earlier this month.

TITLE: Iran suffers drone strike days after US and Israel launched joint military drill in the region
SUMMARY: Iran suffered a drone strike late Saturday evening, its defense ministry announced, as Israel and the U.S. conducted a joint military exercise in the region this week.
